utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: What brings you in today?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I've had a shortness of breath, and even at at rest. Really, feeling like it's difficult to breathe, and when I take a deep breath I get a chest pain.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: When did this start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: This started yesterday.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: How bad is your shortness of breath?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Like, I don't know. I feel like I'm OK, like n terms of being able to breathe, but I mean if I exert myself at all, there's no way I would be able to. It's, I just feel like even at rest it's hard to breathe.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, has it gotten worse since yesterday or better, or kind of been the same?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's mostly been that been the same or actually sorry it's got, got a little bit worse at first. It was more more with exertion, and now it's, at rest as well. So yeah, it's got worse.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see, OK. Are you able to talk in full sentences or do you need to take a deep like stop to take a breath?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I could talk in full sentences.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And the chest pain, does it only occur when you take a deep breath, or are there other times as well?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I pretty much yeah only when I'm taking a deep breath and say, I mean, maybe that's why part of the I can't take a deep breath so it's making me feel it's making the breathing more difficult making me feel more short of breath.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any other symptoms that you've had? A fever or headache?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I, I've had a cough as well over that the same same time period.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Is it a dry cough? Are you bringing something up?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's dry, yeah, I haven't brought up any sputum or any any any blood.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK any other flu like symptoms, runny nose, stuffy nose, sore throat? Anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I just had um, yeah, the shortness of breath and chest pain.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, uhm. And have you, I guess I just invited more general questions about others potential symptoms. Do you feel like your heart is racing or do you feel like you have, uhm, do you have any belly pain or any changes in your bowel movements?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No belly pain or changes to bowel movements, but I do feel like my heart is beating really fast really fast though.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, OK. Uhm, you said this started yesterday. Were you like completely fine the day before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh I was yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Anything that's happened recently that's different or new?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I'm well it like uh, about two weeks ago I had a hysterectomy 'cause I, for abnormal bleeding. Yeah I had surgery 2 weeks ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: What have you been doing these past two weeks in terms of sort of physical activity? Have you been moving around or no?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's it's certainly been less I I've been moving a little bit, but I've had a lot of pain so I just haven't been doing as much activity, that's for sure.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I I see and have you had any, I guess any pain in your legs. Or swelling in your leg? One or the other?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I have had actually, yeah my right my right calf is pretty sore.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Definitely have a look at that. Have you noticed that it's been bigger or more red or warm?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no, I don't notice anything like that, just I, just really hurts.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Uh, OK. Any medical conditions that you've been diagnosed with?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, yeah, yeah and I have a high BMI. Type 2 diabetes and anxiety.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Do you have any bleeding disorders?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um other yeah, no. I think you're right. It said fibroids.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK. And do you take any medication?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, so uh insulin, well metformin. And then that's it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I'm sorry and then an SSRI. Like I said, low pram for anxiety.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright. And do you have any allergies?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I don't.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And, who do you.. do you currently live alone?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, I live with my husband and and our two sons.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and, do you, have anyone sort of come in to help you out over these past two weeks? Are you getting any outside help from nurses etc. Or are your are your family members being supportive and helpful?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, it's been mostly the the family members. My husband's been working from home and the kids have been helpful as well. They are 10 and 12 so they are able to do some things on their own so yeah they've been supportive.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: That's great. That's great. OK, and you smoke at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I do yes I I smoke about a half a pack per day.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: For how long?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, yeah, but I I started in my, yeah, after the kids were born actually, uh so like 10 years ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you tried cutting it down at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I have. I've kind of gone through spurts of quitting and restarting, quitting and restarting. So yeah, I've tried before.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and what about marijuana or recreational drugs?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, don't use anything like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah I'll have some wine on the on the weekends, but maybe that's like a glass or two.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK uhm, and do you have any medical conditions that long run in the family?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Just, uh, yeah, my father actually had a stroke when he was 68, and that's it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK OK uhm. You haven't ever had one, have you?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I I haven't had anything like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, alright. So. I guess come to in terms of smoking, you said that you've tried to quit a couple of times in the past. Do you intend on trying again? I know it can be very hard to, to quit smoking.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, it's only something that is always kind of in the back of my mind.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, if there's I'm happy to assist you and share resources and problems like medications and things like that that could help you if you're interested so we can talk more about that. talking about your I guess you mentioned that your weight is a little higher than or, its outside the normal range, is that something that you would like to cut down?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I really try to eat more vegetables and have been trying to do that sort of thing. I've lost a few pounds, but not enough, definitely want to keep going.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, good good, as long as you feel that you what you're currently doing is helping you and is helping you reduce weight. That's great. But also I'm here for you if you need more education or guidance on that. So, given what you've told me so far, it sounds like you might have developed a clot in your leg somewhere, simply because you had a surgery and you were not moving around very much. Sometimes that causes the blood to kind of, not move around your body is as as much as it usually does, and kind of stays in one place and get turned into a clot and that clot can sometimes get dislodged and settle into your lungs, and that can make it difficult for you to breathe. So, we'll do some tests that that's what my understanding is. Given what you've told me so far, but we do have to confirm it using a test. Also, the fact that you smoke and your weight, and your BMI is high, increases your risk of developing a clot, so I would definitely strongly recommend that you continue to try to reduce both and try to quit smoking. And so we'll do an ultrasound of your leg and we'll do a scan of your chest and see what's going on and then decide if we need to give you any medications, like any blood thinning medications.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: OK, yeah, that sounds really good. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
